title: Herbert Chevell
text:
Herbert Chevell (1888-1960) was an Australian <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1900s and 1910s.
Playing career.
Chevell was a foundation player with the <a href="Newtown%20Jets">Newtown</a> club in 1908, the very first year of the <a href="NSWRFL">NSWRFL</a>. He played three seasons at the club before retiring in 1910. 
Chevell played 4 games for Newtown in 1910 but did not play in the grand final against <a href="South%20Sydney%20Rabbitohs">South Sydney</a> which Newtown won despite drawing 4–4 at full time. Newtown were awarded the premiership due to the fact that they finished minor premiers. Chevell was also a noted <a href="Australian%20Rules">Australian Rules</a> player and a cricketer.
Death.
Chevell died on 3 September 1960 in <a href="Newtown%2C%20New%20South%20Wales">Newtown, New South Wales</a> aged 72.
